comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: Thomas Alfred Field (1874-1944) was a noted pastoralist and meat exporter. A biography is here from Australian Dictionary of Biography: adb.anu.edu.au/biography/field-thomas-alfred-10176

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
It's truly interesting that the most forward, modern design of the 1930s is really close to what they're designing today in the highest fashion places. However, they're not using 100% marble, quartz or alabaster (which ever it is) The clean lines and minimalist approach is all the rage today and has been for many years. In fact, some give credit to the 1960s for this design, this is where they fail. The minimalist design was first seen in France during the early 1920s. The 1960s gleaned those early French designers of the 20s for their most modern 60s design. 

Just goes to show, there really are no new ideas, just new adaptations of old designs.
